meanings.definition: A tool used for measuring angles.
meanings.sent1: I used protractors to measure the angles of the shapes in math class.
meanings.sent2: The students in the geometry class each had their own protractors to use.
meanings.sent3: The protractors at the store were all colorful and shiny, making math more fun.
meanings.sent4: Her precision in using protractors was like a skilled artist painting with a delicate brush.
meanings.sent5: The protractors clicked into place, helping me visualize the angles clearly.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that protracts or lengthens something in time or space.
meanings.sent1: The negotiator acted as a protractors in extending the discussion to find a solution.
meanings.sent2: The construction delays were caused by unforeseen protractors in the planning process.
meanings.sent3: The protractors of the meeting seemed to enjoy dragging out the conversation unnecessarily.
meanings.sent4: His procrastination acted as a protractors, delaying the completion of the project.
meanings.sent5: The protractors of the movie made it feel like it would never end.
